author: Staff Reporter
text:
A seven-member police team has been placed on suspension for letting an accused slip away while in custody.

A sub-inspector and six other police personnel had escorted Syed Ahmed Ali, a resident of Tripura, who was arrested in Vellore for making hoax bomb threats to Christian Medical College, to Lucknow for a court hearing in a train. Ali had escaped from the police men at Itarsi railway station in Madhya Pradesh on the night of October 20. He was terminally ill with cancer and had a history of issuing fake bomb threats to various places.

Following this, a team of police had rushed from Vellore to assist the local police in Madhya Pradesh to locate Ali. They had searched for him, and also displayed photographs at various places but could not find him, a senior police official said.

The official said the seven-member escort team, including the sub-inspector, has been suspended on the grounds of letting an accused slip away from custody.
title: Police personnel placed under suspension
